description: Buy the Shimano GRX WH-RX570 650b Disc Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GRX WH-RX570 650b Disc Wheelset
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano GRX WH-RX570 650b Disc Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The components of the wheel seemed to be fine. However they were laced terribly after a few miles the spokes were popping and pinging then with less than 300 miles they started breaking. I am returning them☹️.
review.name: Not very good

review.reviewBody: Bought the 650bs. Light, stiff and smooth bearings. For the price they are excellent. Running them on my Specialized Diverge and the setup is prefect for off-road/monstercross. Very pleased with the wheels. My only complaint is the valve stems it comes with do not have a removable core. Overall this was a great purchase!
review.name: Best wheel set for the money

review.reviewBody:
got these to finish my monster cross build on the cheap but also b/c custom wheels were taking months due to COVID parts shortages worldwide. the wheels arrived two up in a well packaged and sturdy box, with protective plastic bits keeping them perfect during transport. these are good looking, seem well crafted, and not a loose spoke or misaligned bit of rim tape on either.

came with tubeless rim tape installed, and decent tubeless valves not installed, a plastic spoke wrench, and spacers for converting to 10 or 12 speed (pretty sure) or just fitting a massive cassette. also came with the owners manual. the tires i have made it on the rims easily enough (using palms only), but Panaracer tubeless rubber is notorious for needing the compression from bike shop air systems in order to seat the first time. these were no different. once seated, they lost air about every 48 hours until fully drenched in sealant. now, am only filling weekly.

how do they ride? these are stiff capable wheels that are better than most OEM wheels on bikes costing 1k, with hubs that are comparable to XT level. have taken them on serious single track, massive gravel, and paved roads with no compromise in performance. they have hit some serious boulders and roots but held true thus far. only noticed a slight waiver in rotation of the front recently after 250 miles of rough rides.

the rear hub engages quick and is nearly silent while spinning. i was warned by one mechanic not to be surprised if they need overhauled after 500 or so miles in. but that after repacking of bearings, these wheels do not miss a beat. a pro reviewed the wheelset and didn't think think the bearings should have been so bad upon inspection after so few miles. but another mechanic seemed to have a pretty strong endorsement for them to be a solid rim comparable to wheels costing double. so, maybe they're hit or miss, but I have them in both 700 and 650b and they have performed well for the cost.
review.name: Competant GRX Wheelset Stays True

name: GRX WH-RX570 650b Disc Wheelset

review.reviewBody:
Material and design feel a lot like my more expensive bibs from Velocio, the soft straps and laser-cut edges are a great touch but I suspect the leg openings may fray over time.

Size charts put me on the edge of a size S but I might recommend sizing up: while the fit across the thighs is good, especially after the first washing, the material in the front panel is high and compressive enough that it sits tight and is hard to pull down to pee. Won't be my first choice for long endurance rides.
review.name: Deluxe finish at a reasonable price

review.reviewBody: These bib shorts are so light feeling I almost forget they're there! It's my first pair of bibs (typically wear shorts) and I really like the bib design and how it keeps the shorts from rolling or slipping. I purchased 2XL and they seem true to size. They feel bigger than I expected considering a lot bike brands run small, but these are great and fit like a typical 2XL running short does. I can't wait for
review.name: Insanely Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: Between sun hoodies and waffle fleeces like the paradigmatic R1, I (and probably all of us high-output athletes) have a quiver of base-to-mid weight, slim-fit hoodies. I gave into the temptation to add this new article because it was wool, thinner, had the quarter zip, and the all-black is passable as a foundation piece for more urban activities, like beers on a patio on a fall evening or whatever. So far it has performed as expected--both on trails and on patios. It's my only top garment on runs between 25 and 40 degrees fahrenheit. If you are wearing a running vest or maybe a Cirque-series ski pack, you can operate in even colder temps with this piece alone. Medium fits great for me (6'1", 165 lbs).
review.name: Thin Hoodie #110

review.itemreviewed: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: Slightly itchy but really warm, great breathability.
review.name: Great but runs small!

review.itemreviewed: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought to use in winter while back country touring, I like the length as it stays tucked in , light weight material, only thing that prevents it from5 stars is the hood is fairly loose and not a true "scuba " style that zips up tight to the chin
review.name: Nice baselayer

review.itemreviewed: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: Just perfect mid base layer. Hood is just super useful under helmets. Mountaineering or skiing. For both this top is just perfect. Overall good fit. Just arms are little bit narrow. But still better to go with usual size.
review.name: Perfect !

review.itemreviewed: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is perfect for hiking! Adds warmth without the weight. Will be using to hike the Dolomites!
review.name: Warm and light

review.itemreviewed: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have both colors of this baselayer. Living in NH it can be worn year round either as a first layer or as the only layer when it gets warmer. The hood is perfect for under a helmet when snowboarding. The zipper goes pretty low for days when the sun comes out. Recommend the hooded version over the non hooded.
review.name: Comfy and fits perfect

review.itemreviewed: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: Soft, light and warm. I love the baselayer so much more than the black diamond alpenglow sun hoodie that I bought. It feels more premium, I didn't have any loose threads and it the fit is great. Kept me warm and didn't make me sweat. Definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a new baselayer.
review.name: Two thumbs up

review.itemreviewed: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Solution 150 (with hood) has to be my favorite base layer so far! Hiking the AT on a cold day I can wear this all day and night, minimal odor, keeps me warm and wicked. And I like the way the green looks!! Best piece of gear I've picked up this year
review.name: Awesome, my fav!

review.itemreviewed: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: BD makes great gear and this baselayer is no exception. Personally, I love it for fly fishing! It has a nice flex and provides great warmth.
review.name: Perfect baselayer!

review.itemreviewed: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the feel of this baselayer, next to skin comfort is very nice and the fit is perfect! Size Large, 6'2" 175 lbs
review.name: Great fit and feel

name: Solution Wool Half-Zip Hooded Baselayer Top - Men's

review.itemreviewed: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Turned to Merrell after learning that replacing grommets on my winter Salomons was mire than these Merrells. Tried them late fall on leaf covered ledges and steep sugar roads. Good traction and ankle support. Went sliding in 19 degrees and building wind. Feet nice and toasty. Praying fir beaucoup snow and long sniwshoe treks on my woodies.
review.name: So far pretty darn good!
comment: Thank you for the fantastic feedback!

review.itemreviewed: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots two months ago for the main reason they offered the Arctic Grip Soles . I live in interior Alaska & I’m very active in the outdoors for work & recreation so far they have met my expectations of anti slip , warm , dry, & lightweight. In the first week of wear I decided that they were a game changer for winter boots so I ordered another for a backup just in case Merrill in the future discontinued the Arctic Grip Soles ( PLEASE DONT)
review.name: Vibram Arctic Grip Soles , Ankle Support, Gore Tex

review.itemreviewed: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable hiking boots I've worn, and the Vibram Arctic Grip outsoles are incredible, I hiked multiple 14ers in winter conditions and they held up great with one very significant flaw, I wound up in situations where I was postholing in snow a couple of times, and it was consistently the case that the laces would pop off the shoes' hooks and I'd wind up with snow inside the boot. Really awful when it happened. When I went out with gaiters I had no issues, but I don't know that I would repurchase these due to this happening multiple times. If you aren't trekking through deep snow these are the most breathable, comfortable out of the box hiking boots I've ever worn, and the grip is insane, I've never needed to wear Microspikes with these boots, even on treacherous icy terrain. They're also great with snowshoes.
review.name: Incredible boots with one fatal flaw

review.itemreviewed: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: One of the top lace clips broke off on my 2nd wear. Otherwise, I like the shoe.
review.name: Good design, a quality control issue
comment: We stand behind our products and we'd love the opportunity to help. Please give us a call at 800-288-3124 or live chat at Merrell.com.

review.itemreviewed: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Overall, very satisfied with the shoes.  Being a mailman walking 25kms per day, traction and waterproof are paramount, and these deliver.

Only con i have come across is that the hooks catch the laces from time to time if youre not careful while you walk, causing you to trip.
review.name: Great shoe, but be careful
comment: We value and appreciate your feedback.

review.itemreviewed: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I recently purchased a pair of Merrell boots, which I was eager to try. Their appearance was quite appealing, but unfortunately, they failed to meet my expectations in terms of quality. During their first real test in a snowstorm, I discovered that they were not properly sealed, resulting in my feet getting wet.
review.name: Boots Not Sealed Properly
comment: We're sorry to hear this happened to you. We stand behind our products and we'd love to do all we can to help. We have a 1 year warranty on our products for any manufacturing defects. Please visit our ‘Contact Us’ page at the link below and fill out the Defective Product Form to start a warranty claim. If you need any assistance with the form give the team a call at 800-288-3124. Thank you. https://tinyurl.com/bdcuxst9

review.itemreviewed: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've worn these boots in the cold and rain, and they've kept my feet warm and dry. Walking for long periods, on concrete in particular, they remain comfortable.
review.name: Warm/Dry/Comfortable
comment: You deserve the comfort! Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I work in package delivery, which means a lot of time outdoors and walking up to about 150 front porches each day.   When the weather is cold, these are my go to work boot (in rainy weather I use the Agility Peak 5 Zero).  In sub freezing temperatures these boots are marvelous.  My feet are always perfectly warm.  The sole is particularly grippy, perfect for slippery wooden porch steps.  This “boot” is as lightweight and comfy as athletic shoes while offering great protection.   I feel no urge to take it off at the end of a 10 hour shift.
review.name: Perfect for package delivery in the winter.
comment: That's fantastic! Thank you for sharing your feedback.

review.itemreviewed: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: these boots are spectacular! the grippy tread give me Best a secure feeling while on snow and ice!
review.name: Best Boots
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback with us!

review.itemreviewed: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Seems like Merrell listened to the feedback. They improved the durability of the eyelets and gaiter hook vs the thermo rogue 3s.  Perfect winter hiking boots for active hikes.
review.name: Big improvement over the last version

name: MTL Thermo Rogue 4 Mid GTX Boot - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the wide toe box and ankle support. Comftable and ablecto hike many miles in a day with these hiking shoes.
review.name: Hoka hikers

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Even though they are a hiking type boot, I use them primarily for walking. I like the ankle support. Hoka came highly recommended by my podiatrist. I was disappointed when just a few days after purchasing them straight from the HOKA sight, they sent me an ad for the same boot for $40.00 less. Am waiting to hear if they have an adjustment policy so that I may get the difference back.
review.name: Love these boots!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had high expectation about this hiking boots since my foot hurts and i need a good pair. The width and high are really nice. But the front bottom of the foot does not feel support. I was very disappointed since it is a very expensive pair of hiking boots. But I am leaving to my trip so I will keep it and put insoles in it. It feels like my foot is right on the ground, not in a shoe.
review.name: the front of the foot has no support

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The most important is that this boot is very breathable. The sole is thick enough for me to travel around walking on different surface. The top is high and protective without making my ankles uncomfortable. I am buying this shoe for my healing foot. It serves the purpose 70%. My affected foot still feels hurt or tired after walking for an hour.
review.name: High Quality

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have owned my pair of HOKAs for several years. My 26-year-old daughter, who is the one who introduced me to the brand, now has two pairs. Knowing how comfortable they are, I recently purchased the Anacapa Breeze Mid for my 18-year-old daughter who has significant physical and cognitive impairments. She hates wearing shoes and is always taking them off on the school bus or in the classroom. The Anacapa provides support around her ankles, making it difficult for her to take them off. She has been much more mobile at school since she started wearing them and does not even try to take them off! She is nonverbal so she can't say what she thinks of her new Hokas, but the fact that she is walking more at school and doesn't even try to take them off tells me that she finds them to be comfortable. I am very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Yet another reason to live HOKA

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I loved this shoe but I got a defective one and by the time I was able to first wear them it was too late to return. So now I have an expensive hiking shoe that I really liked, but I can't lace them up they they are they are defective.
review.name: They broke the first time I wore them:/

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I brought wrong style and would like GTX. How can I increase H20 resistence of this non gortex model
review.name: Can I make them ore water resistant?

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have searched for years for a hiking shoe/boot that would work for my narrow, high arched feet. After 5-6 miles with numerous brands my feet would be killing me even with a variety of expensive arch support inserts. Just finished a 9 mile hike in these & my feet don't hurt! Thank you! I will be getting another pair as a backup.
review.name: Finally a hiking boot that's perfect for me!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Cheapest quality sneakers I've ever purchased. They should be sold at the 99 cent store.
review.name: Garbage

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: The first time I wore these for a long hike, I brought other shoes just in case. I didn't even think about the other shoes the entire day. These boots are so comfortable right away and require no break-in period. The high top keeps me from rolling my ankles and the sole is responsive on all terrains. New favorite hiking boot!
review.name: So light and comfortable!

name: Anacapa Breeze Mid Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Live this style and brand. Thanks for keeping me walking!
review.name: Repeat Order

review.reviewBody: I was excited to upgrade my Superior 5's to the 6's and I was very disappointed. The toe box is so narrow that I haven't even attempted a run in them and won't.
review.name: Not the same fit as the Superior 5

review.reviewBody: I have run in the superiors for at least 5 years. For whatever reason, the superior 6 are some of the LEAST comfortable shoes I have ever worn - something I have never thought about an Altra.
review.name: So uncomfortable.

review.reviewBody: After having a great experience with the Superior 5, I cannot believe why they would change the Superior 6 to being so tight and narrow in the mid and fore foot. As a Physiotherapist specialising in biomechanics, these definitely do not promote splaying of the feet and a natural movement. Caused significant pain and brought back old injuries. The heel cup or back is too low whihc then pulled my socks down into the shoe. The only good thing is that the grip is better than the Superior 5 that was very slippery in the wet.
review.name: Such a shame

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. Ample toe box. They are solid on my feet but don't swallow my ankle bones. Good traction. Soles wear well. They are available in low-key colors and they are pretty easy to clean.
review.name: I have bought multiple pairs! Never want to be without.

review.reviewBody: Wow. I loved the superior 5. I can't believe how narrow these are. Toebox feels ok but it squeezes my foot. Such an awful fit I didn't even try to run in them. Why change the sizing when it's supposed to be the same shoe?
review.name: Disappointment

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of superiors, though first of this generation. Generally I like them, but they feel weirdly tight over the center and middle of my foot, even with laces ~as loose as possible.
review.name: Good not great

review.reviewBody: I recently bought the Superior 6 after being a fan of the superior 5 for many years. I had to return them because they have extended the rubber toe past where it used to be thus causing pain in the small toe. Why did you ruin an incredible shoe that actually worked and was extremely comfortable? Please go back to the superior 5 style and don't mess with something that is already incredible. Luckily I was able to find several pairs of superior 5 elsewhere.
review.name: Why mess with perfection

review.reviewBody: I gave a negative review of the Superior 6 model and it really was a different shoe from the past. I'm thrilled to report that I went to a local outdoor and climbing store and tried on a couple of different Altras. The feel and fit of the Lone Peak 8 was fantastic. I bought my usual size and I am so happy. Please keep making this model with the perfect toe box and roomy feel in the front of the shoe, Altra. For these of us with wide feet you are the BEST!
review.name: Review Update - found the right Altra!

author.name: Was Bummed but found perfect Altra!

review.reviewBody: I was a SUPERFAN and hoped I could count on Altra shoes. But in the 4 years since my last order they've drastically changed. As others stated the inside volume in the front of the shoe is tight. The wide toe box doesn't compensate. It is a completely different fit. I Will try another model of Altra but I fear the company may not be accommodating the specific needs they once did. ) :
review.name: Disappointed about Superior 6 changes

name: Superior 6 Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Pretty disappointed with how warm these boots keep your feet. Very thick, and they are slightly hard to put on, the pull tab at the back could be quite a bit bigger and that would help. They are very comfortable though, so I will give them that. Pretty stiff boot, so there is not a lot of ankle mobility so keep that in mind. Seem pretty durable so far though through 4 months of almost daily use. Definitely not a bad boot for the money, but that -40 degree rating is exaggerated and the main detractor.
review.name: Disappointed but not bad

review.reviewBody: I expected a big boot given that this one is rated to -40F, however this boot's insulation was a bit thicker and stiffer than I expected. So it's warm but the dexterity is lacking, particularly around the ankles, perhaps by design. Sizing is true to size, I wear a size 9 and the 9 fits me here.
review.name: Too thick

review.reviewBody: Great fit and it is super cozy. Hopefully it will last
review.name: Fantastic coat

review.reviewBody: I just received this coat and it is SO cozy! It feels like wearing a blanket without actually wearing a blanket and looking ridiculous. I plan to keep it at my cold office as a “cardigan” but I imagine it would be lovely to wear on fall walks. I did not size down despite the oversized style (Purchased M) and it fits fine. The sleeves are a tad long and wide but the body is perfectly sized, with room to layer. Small probably would have been too tight. The two way-zipper is handy. The outside fleece is like a boucle wool which doesn’t not shed and the inside is surprisingly smooth and cushy. Glad I finally just made this purchase!
review.name: So Cozy

review.reviewBody: A great cozy jacket to throw on for running errands and outdoor activities. It is so soft and provides a surprising resistance to wind. The fit is slightly oversized and flattering. The arms are nice and long and isn't too snug across the chest.
review.name: So cozy

review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month ago and am very happy with this jacket.
review.name: Longer length, just right!

review.reviewBody: Women's Juneau Fleece Hoodie is better size on the larger side
review.name: good

review.reviewBody: Patagonia what? This fleece is simply awesome. It ticks all the boxes in terms of comfort, warmth, and style. It was a gift for my girlfriend and she absolutely loves it. 100% recommended fleece coat.
review.name: Awesome fleece coat

review.reviewBody: I just got a navy blue fleece. I love color and design. Super warm and cozy. It is not only trim very well but also very stylish. I just love this.
review.name: Love this!!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this in black, size small. The fit is good. I like the longer length for warmth. It is a cute, casual look. The weight is heavier, so it is very warm. It is a fun, different look for fleece. The only drawback is because it is a heavier fleece the inside of the arms stick to clothing when trying to put it on.
review.name: Sherpa fleece

review.reviewBody: This jacket is comfy and warm. Downside is that animal fur sticks to it but then again I've come to terms with animals fur on all my clothes. Would recommend
review.name: Comfy

review.reviewBody: I received this and went to write review and it is less expensive, the color is much darker than shown.
review.name: no

review.reviewBody: I've been using Mountain House for decades for backcountry and hiking and the chicken & mashed potatoes is definitely my new favorite.
review.name: Awesome taste!

review.reviewBody: Omg these are the best! It is like homemade food! I seriously eat this at home often! I wish more places carried this flavor.
review.name: So good! Tastes like real mashed potatoes

review.reviewBody: Want a very filling and high protein dinner that's comforting and has high protein? This your meal! I brought a thermos with hot water and heated my chicken and mashed potatoes after hiking a Colorado 14er. It was so satisfying and kept me full for the rest of the hike.
review.name: Comforting and high protein meal

review.reviewBody: This tastes so good! Preparation was easy as all it needs is water. Mashed potatoes were creamy and the garlic flavor was not overwhelming. My kiddo enjoyed it and I'll be purchasing this one again.
review.name: Great Flavor!

review.reviewBody: This is what I want to eat if the power goes out or when I go camping. It's quick, easy, and tastes great!
review.name: Tastes Great

review.reviewBody: Great tasting meal, I added 1/8 cup more water and a pad of butter along with some Slap Ya Momma perfect.
review.name: Fantastic amount of Protien

review.reviewBody: Have been a long time backpacker.   Always pick mountain house.  The chicken and mashed potatoes is by far my favorite.  I’ve never had an entree I didn’t like.  Can’t go wrong
review.name: Very satisfying and tasty

review.reviewBody: Too bad this is a limited release.  Everything about it is great.  Flavor, texture and easy to prepare.  I find this meal is the closest to instructions when it comes to amount of water.  I use one and two-thirds cup and it comes out great every time.  Would buy this every order if it was a regular.
review.name: One of the Best

review.reviewBody: The gluten free meals that Mountain House makes have been used by me but my favorite is this meal.  Great taste, easy to use and satisfying all my requirements.
review.name: Gluten Free and really tasty

review.reviewBody: I have been eating your food since the early 90s, and beef stroganoff was my favorite until I tried this one. Certainly you have many other greats, but this one is the best !

review.itemreviewed: EQUIPE R Bib Shorts S9 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Out-of-the-box impression: Disappointingly flimsy fabric. Poor quality butt padding material, not well finished, with "wings" in the crotch area that are not sewn down to the outer fabric. The "wings" just flap. A quick try-on verified my first impression; poor (loose) fit around the knees. I would not trust the pad on a ride. Back they go.
review.name: Surprisingly pool quality for the price

description: Buy the Black Diamond Helio Carbon 104 Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Helio Carbon 104 Ski - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Helio Carbon 104 Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Helio Carbon 104 Ski - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Helio Carbon 104 Ski - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I am 6'1 and have put the current version of this ski through its paces for a season of backcountry skiing in the Whistler backcountry and a trip to the Selkirks. Love how light this ski is for its size. Combined with the ATK Raider an amazingly light and capable setup. Super fun on 30 cm days and can carve some turns on the groomers if needed. I am a private ski instructor at Whistler Blackcomb and spend as many days as possible in the backcountry. I know my skis.
review.name: Love the Helio carbon 104

review.reviewBody: You cannot go wrong with this ski. It's an incredible blend of light weight and performance. One recc: If in doubt, size down. The boards stay snappy in tight situations at very little expense to flotation or edge holding. Bravo
review.name: The Best

review.reviewBody: These skis are not too heavy and not too light (though they're pretty darn light!). They play wonderfully in the pow, but also have enough "ski" in them to perform well on the firm or variable.
review.name: Goldilocks: just right

review.reviewBody: Received two different skis in the same package. Trying to get it fixed and being told it could take over 3 weeks and they might not be able to even fix it.
review.name: Ski Quality Poor

review.reviewBody: Arrived as expected. Excited to get these mounted and enjoy the uphill.
review.name: Stoked for the uphill!

review.reviewBody: Only been on them two days so far in variable conditions due to windpack. Felt great in the softer snow but could do better on choppy hardpack. Went with the recommended mounting point though instead of closer to center which I typically prefer and may have helped.
review.name: Good in the fluff, could be better in the hardpack

review.reviewBody:
Very light, ski well, and pretty design!
Got 108mm brakes for the 104mm skis, which fit well.
review.name: Very light

review.reviewBody: Very light skis for longs days but widths enough to ejyoy deep snows!!
review.name: Light and efficient

review.reviewBody: these skis look great - adding bindings this week and heading out soon - expecting good performance when they get in the snow.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: Whether powder, corn or steep technical lines, these skis are all you need. Mounted with ATK 12’s, you now have no excuse not to tour until the sun sets because you won’t feel their weight on the skin track. Build quality seems excellent. Flat tails for the win!
review.name: If you can only have one ski, this is it

name: Helio Carbon 104 Ski - 2025

review.reviewBody: I took my Roller Bag on its first trip recently. I love how it holds my things, but the outside had some big black stains that won’t come out and a few punctures. I was hoping it would be much tougher.

review.reviewBody: This is a great Bag. Well made with good wheels and zippers. The carry handles are super strong. I travel with work and this is my new go to checked Bag. It’s my second Cotapaxi bag. The first is still going strong. I recommend this Brand to anyone.
review.name: 65L Roller Bag is Great!

review.itemreviewed: S237 V1 Suede Mesh Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Love these overall. Compared to my 574 and 327s, I'd say they're somewhere in-between those 2 styles. Very light and sporty yet casual that it can be worn almost anywhere. I like them as an everyday shoe, although I don't like them as much for walking longer distances as the 574s or 327s. I think this is due to the shape, very flat and firm mid-sole. Good for short/medium walks, but I'd sooner wear 574s or 327s for a long walk and I find the 327s have much better grip than these and they have a bit better support as well.

Sizing and fit is perfect. They feel TTS in a size 11 which is what I wear in the 327s. The tongue is also comfortable and I feel I could wear the shoes all day no problem. They have good breathability as well and don't get hot (wore them for 8+ hours a couple of times).

Quality is also really good. The suede is nice and the rest of the materials seem very durable. Not a ton of cushioning on the inside, but with a good pair of socks it's more than enough.

Overall I'd definitely recommend these for a casual/daily shoe. Just be aware that you may find other NB shoes better for walking or running in. This is really a casual wear shoe for sure.
review.name: Great everyday shoes

name: S237 V1 Suede Mesh Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I wanted a pair of leather Teva's to wear with dresses. I have the leather Original Universal Slim sandals which I love. They fit great and are easy to wear wherever. I wanted something that had more of a "heel" to give me height. I found these are the same width and strap lengths are what I expected in Tevas. I read the reviews but figured the "foot slides forward" issue was for some only. Well, it is happening with me. Something about the leather foot bed or the non-adjustable heel strap is causing my feet to slide forward in these shoes. YES, I can adjust the strap across the top of my foot to stop this somewhat, but I hate that feeling of being strapped in too tightly. YES, I can tighten the strap across my ankle, but again, it becomes uncomfortable. We discussed this at work since we all love TEVAs. The consensus was it may be the foot bed that is slippery, no friction to stop the forward slide. I do not really know. The overall look is so cute I will not return them. I could not wear these on a long walk or in a situation where I know I will be walking a lot because my foot will be hanging off the front of the shoe. PRO: shoes are cute (I got the Neutral Multi), they will look great with skirts and dresses, they are adjustable CON: feet slides forward on both, especially walking downhill or down stairs, I can tighten the straps but it is very uncomfortable
review.name: Foot slides forward - I cannot figure out why

review.reviewBody: They description said fit wide feet. Well not mine. Too short and too narrow
review.name: Probably won't buy again

review.reviewBody: So comfortable and easy to wear. I love my Tevas. They are *just the right size and could be a touch bigger but they do fit and are cozy.
review.name: Love em!

review.reviewBody: It fits like the back strap is not set far enough back. The shoe is long enough but after I put them on and walk, my toes are hanging off the front of the shoe. Was very disappointed because I have owned Teva's before and didn't have this problem. In fact I have a pair that are over 20 years old that I wear when cutting grass.
review.name: Not this particular style.

review.reviewBody: So comfortable! Fit is perfect. Will definitely buy more!
review.name: Absolutely love!

review.reviewBody: Overall I am satisfied with this purchase. Only critique is the quality of the material isn't what I was expecting. In 2017-2018 I bought two pairs of slides in the same material and they wore/aged so beautifully leather wise and I was expecting the same from these. Maybe they will the more I wear them as I've only had them a few weeks but the material definitely seems different than previous styles. Other than that they are comfy and I am happy with the purchase.
review.name: Material appears different from years past ...

review.reviewBody: I was very excited about getting these! I love the brand and wanted the leather ones to be a little more dressy compared to my others. Unfortunately, I wore them for about 3 hours and the outside strap disconnected from the bottom of the shoe. I put in for a return so hopefully these will be better
review.name: Disappointed but going to give it another try

review.reviewBody: There has to be a disgnflaw or manufacturing mistake. Take these off the market! After only a few wears the strap came out of the sole, looks like this is a common occurrence with the other reviews. I have worn Tevas for years and have hikes, kayaked, ect and no problems. I bought these for more of an everyday " nicer looking" sandal. I splurged and was disappointed. I did start the return process and plan on going back to the OG style.
review.name: Design Flaw

review.reviewBody: Using them on my second time strap came out from the sole
review.name: Disappointed in the quality

review.reviewBody: These arrived with scuffed looking black leather footbeds and the ankle strap was very short compared to my non-leather universal originals. The Velcro could only barely catch and not enough to hold the sandal on my ankles. While the color scheme was lovely, the strap size discrepancy and quality of the footbed had me requesting return right out of the box. Bummed.
review.name: Very Disappointing Quality, Short Strap

name: Midform Universal Leather Sandal - Women's

description: Buy the Eureka! Tetragon NX 3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Eureka! Tetragon NX 3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have the 10’x12’ version of this tent that is why I chose this tent for spike camps on fires. I was a little disappointed that the zipper on this tent was not heavier duty.
review.name: Light weight Zipper

review.reviewBody:
This is a decent tent at a decent price. I was able to set it up single-handedly, though it’s definitely easier with two people. I put it up in my yard for a trial run on a night when rain was coming and the  interior stayed dry. I haven’t camped in rain yet myself, but I think it will perform pretty well. 

I have a couple nit-picky thoughts on design decisions, so I didn’t give it 5 stars. One is that I would feel a bit more secure in driving rain or in more populated camp grounds if I could close the mesh area that is in the wall across from the door. Not being able to make the tent closed to driving rain or random passers-by looking in makes me a little uneasy. 

The other is the height of the lip under the door. I would appreciate it being a little shorter. 

Other than these two issues, I’m pretty pleased with my purchase.
review.name: A pretty good tent at a pretty good price

review.reviewBody: I've owned many Eureka tents and they have always been a great value, I wanted one this time for car and cycling events camping. I measured my single blow up mattress before I ordered it, but it is a little crowded for my gear and mattress, should have gotten the next size bigger, but it functioned and I was able to stay dry in the rain, plus the lower profile will be better in thunderstorms. I will just have to pack a little lighter.
review.name: Great Value 3 Season Tent

review.reviewBody: Took this tent to a campground near Monument Valley and it did not do so well in very windy conditions.  The stakes did not hold and the wind blew dirt up through the top open area even with the rainfly top on.
review.name: Not great in windy conditions.
comment: Thank you for the time out to leave your review. Your feedback is important to us, and we'll be sure to pass it along to our quality team to review. I am sorry that you are not satisfied with your Tetragon NX 3 Person Tent. We would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your concerns. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is such a compact tent and easy to set up “as directed.” We attempted to set up the tent indoors (don’t do that..do “as directed”) to see how it worked which is not a good idea. Whether for backyard camp outs or outdoor camping, this tent will work great! Just secure the tent base/floor before inserting the two poles to “pop up” the tent. Enjoy!
review.name: Tent for 3

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I cannot wait until warmer weather here in indiana so i can go camping and try out that amazing tent i love the color and how big it is the tent is going to look great with a fire burning and relaxing
review.name: Cant until spring

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got the tetragon NX 3 as a smaller tent to keep in my vehicle for traveling. It’s perfectly packed so it won’t take up a lot of space. It is very easy to put together and take down. I used it for two people and had more than enough space. This is a great tent.
review.name: Very Nice!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for just a little tent that was not to hard to put up or take down and that did not take up to much room so it would be easy to pack and the tetragon nx3 is just that very well made nice heavy material easy to set up and take down and not to mention looks great when put up
review.name: very well made and stylish

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Eureka! - Tetragon NX 3 is a nice tent. I love how it comes packaged. Instructions come attached to the bag with all the sticks. The tent is a nice design. Easy to travel with put in the trunk of the car or keep in the house when ready to go camping. The instructions were fairly easy, putting a tent together can be complicated but I figured it out. I like that the Eureka! - Tetragon NX 3 has a cover for the top of the tent to keep the rain out. This tent is spacious for 3 people we have 4 in our family and we all fit in nicely. I would recommend this product!!
review.name: Nice product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this a month ago and I'm so glad I did. This tent is great for all kinds of weather waterproof and is very big and spacious on the inside fits up to 5 people and very durable and well made. I definitely recommend it.
review.name: Great product

name: Tetragon NX 3 Tent: 3-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very spacious and functional tent for 2 people. The wings are a great addition to store gear without taking sleeping space, and the rainfly performs very well in inclement weather. Small enough for a weekend overnight backpacking trip
review.name: Roomy 2P Backpacking Tent

review.reviewBody: Easy set up.  Lots of room for one person and a dog.
review.name: Great tent!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great 2 person tent on the inside and feels much bigger when your inside it which is great but I have noticed 2 things, compared to another 2 person tent that I have the pack size is much larger so instead of fitting in my Backcountry bag like the smaller one I have it takes up bottom to top on my bag): that's on me I should've checked pack size, second is the weight difference compared to online, on site it says it weighes around 4 pounds and a lil more, when I got the product it's more over 5 which isn't a problem just weird. I will say it's a sick tent overall and has great construction along with color coded poles alligned as one for easy setup
review.name: Great finale shape and inside but.
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for providing us with feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear that the item has not fully met your expectations.
 
At Marmot, we strive for excellence and we set a high standard for ourselves, and we’re so sorry to hear this was not met in your interaction with our brand. We greatly value our consumers' insights, which are collected and shared with our product development teams for consideration. 

The weight difference you mentioned is likely due to the fact that the minimum weight of the Limelight 2P tent is 4lbs 15.4oz, which includes the poles, tent body, and flysheet only, however, the total weight would be around 5lbs 14.5oz.
 
We are happy to assist in resolving any issues you may experience with our products, and if you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Killer product. I have a few 2-person tents and this is my go to now. Love the extra space on the side for additional gear in your tent without taking up your sleeping room.
review.name: Simply the best

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've used this tent for many years of backpacking and car camping and it has held up great. The setup is easy and intuitive, probably one of the fastest tents to set up that I've owned.
review.name: Easy to use and durable

review.reviewBody: Had this tent on my motorcycle trip around the world and the window melted out and then the zipper gave out and not a warranty item?
review.name: Buyer beware

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So I bought this tent for a trip into the Angeles mountains with friends and it was great !! It’s the little things that matter with this tent. You have ample room with the vestibules areas and the poles are colored coded so it only took me 5 minutes to set up the actual tent. I got my socks wet during the trip and clothes hanger worked perfectly along with having more than enough room inside.
review.name: Great 3 season Tent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This tent is amazing. Very spacious for two people. Easy set up. Some condensation as to be expected with any tent. The condensation stayed on the tent fly and was a non issue for me. The tent easily fit inside my 45L pack. The tent packs up into its packaging with ease. Absolutely no struggle trying to roll up the tent and place in carry sack.
review.name: Amazing Tent

review.reviewBody:
For the price, the Limelight is a solid performer. It's the style and size that the majority of outdoor folks will at some point. It also won't break the bank. While ultralight tents shine for the fast packers and the weight conscious, the price for weight savings is a non linear formula. In other words you'll pay a lot more for a lot less when it comes to shaving ounces.

I've used the lImelight in all its configurations over the years. Mine has been to Mexico, the Andes, and all over the US. It's a good three season performer and works even in the odd snowstorm. It's light enough to travel well and carry (if load is shared between two people).
review.name: Inexpensive Performance

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I travelled alone on a road trip for a couple weeks. On the road trip I was setting up and tearing down the Limelight 2 by myself on a daily basis. Compared to many other tents I have used it was a breeze and I could set it up and tear down in only a few minutes.
review.name: EASY TO SET UP AND DURABLE

name: Limelight Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Dynalock Explore Poles online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Nice poles at a good price 
Haven't had any issues. Locks work well and don't slip
review.name: Nice Poles.

review.reviewBody:
So as expected with collapsable poles, there are compromises. They are a lot more flexible than one-piece ski poles, and obviously more fragile. I haven't broken them yet though, and the adjustable cam levers are a great feature. 

The worst part is the foam grips. Every time they touch the snow, a thick coating of it sticks to the grips like glue, and then it melts and gets your gloves wet, and the water runs down to the lower part of the foam grip and turns to ice, which is impossible to knock off the foam.

Check the maximum length of these poles - might not be long enough for some people to use as ski poles.
review.name: Grips are a problem, otherwise decent with some tradeoffs

review.reviewBody: Used on one backpacking trip and one of our poles bent. It needs to be replaced. Have not heard back from MSR customer service yet-been one week. Would help if you had a phone number. Would appreciate help with this issue. Our other backpacking poles lasted 40 years! Please help.
review.name: broken pole

review.reviewBody: Love the poles, amazing customer service. Had a pair that broke, customer service was amazing an sent me a new set out at blazing speed. When opened I noticed that after extending them the bottom section of the pole had a small bend. I thought it was my eyes playing tricks on me. Since these were just replaced I haven't the gauld to call them up. Wish I was able to just receive the last section on the dynalock explorer set. Does anyone know if that's even an option?
review.name: Last pair fell short

review.reviewBody: A little bit too bulky for storing on backpack. But they are still good and sturdy.
review.name: A little bit too bulky

review.reviewBody:
poles were fantastic for exporing the backcountry untill it just broke one day going down the hill, to my horror there is a crack at every single opening above the adjustment clamps. 

Conclusion, they will break not a question of if it is a question of when. engineering error, stess concentrations... this stuff can happen
review.name: great poles until they are not

review.reviewBody: By far the best pole I ever used. I take them for splitboarding and telemark. High quality product. Super light, locking system is a pleasure to use. A++
review.name: Top Quality

review.reviewBody: Excellent Poles! Super easy to adjust and lightweight. The interchangeable baskets are great for the seasons. Took them out this weekend on an icy/snowy..made the trip even more enjoyable having the added balance!
review.name: Excellent poles!!

review.reviewBody:
I just bought these and did 5 of uphill and downhill hiking with them. They worked great. Only two problems:
1) the clamps don’t clamp tight enough when the poles are closed up for transporting in my backpack so the extension keeps sliding down about 10”. I finally just clamped them at that point but would prefer they’d stay shorter. Not sure if this is a warranty issue. 
2) the small baskets for summer hiking fit on very tightly and I was sure they would stay on. But after about 3 miles I looked down and one was gone. Not sure how it got off. So, I came to the site to see if they sell extras but they’re not on the website. I’m sure I’m not the only person to experience this and it would seem to be a logical thing to sell.
review.name: Nice but…

review.reviewBody: These are the strongest easiest to use poles I have ever had. They are light and can take abuse on rocky slippery trail.
review.name: Light and rugged

name: Dynalock Explore Poles

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Full disclosure that I believe Backcountry will make this situation right, but I cannot believe what I just received from ASSOS. I have multiple pairs of these bibs and while they are the “budget” ASSOS bib, they generally hold up well. So I bought another pair after a previous one wore out. The pair I received this round DOES NOT EVEN HAVE COMPLETE STITCHING IN PLACE FOR THE CHAMOIS. How is this even possible? How did this pass quality inspection and make it to Backcountry’s warehouse?? I attached a photo for comparison and reference. The bibs on the right are correctly stitched, and the ones on the left after the garbage I received this round.  Unfortunately I’m going to have to go on a very reluctant but necessary search for a new bib manufacturer, as this is unacceptable.
review.name: ASSOS quality has gone down

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is my 4th Assos bibs within last 15 years. I have been extremely happy with all the three different bibs (one for winter tight) I purchased before. Over 15+ years I have tried very different brands and concluded that, albeit they are quite pricey, Assos bibs are the best bibs for me. 
I purchased the Mille GT C2 looking to get a mid-range (30-50 mile) distance comfort and replace my overused first Assos bibs, I use my Cento EVO bibs for longer rides. I have read the reviews at this site and agree with most of the positive points made. From my perspective, I would say that these are not the best Assos bibs I have purchased but they are the cheapest and are pretty decent ones so far for me. I have found Assos to be sized smaller, my other brand bibs are usually large, but all my Assos bibs are x-large which works well with my body. I am 6-0 ft and 185 pounds. I have been using these bibs last 3 weeks for a total of roughly 300 miles averaging 40-45 miles each outing. As one of the reviewer's pointed out, I noticed some bunching in the crouch area as I get to 25-35 miles distance but pulling from the bottom of the thighs takes care of the slight discomfort for the rest of the ride. I would definitely recommend them.
review.name: Pretty Good Bibs for Mid-Range Rides

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is my 4th pair of the Assos MILLE GT C2 Bib Short - a crash replacement. It took a long time to find bibs that fit me well as we're all different - I'm 5'10" and 153lbs with narrow sitz bones and these bibs are super comfy for me. I ride indoors and out, with longer rides being 4-6 hours so no issue with endurance.

Assos sizing is small, the size chart doesn't represent reality in my experience so I sized up to a Large otherwise the legs are too short and narrow leading to a lot of fabric rucking where you don't want it. Worth mentioning as well that the pair I'm replacing stood up very well in the crash, but since the damage was on the hip Assos couldn't repair as they said it would make the shorts part uncomfortable with the patching. Kudos anyway that they offer this service for just $25.
review.name: Great quality, watch the fit

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I purchased these bibs after reading a review of bibs overall that had these at the top. I think the fit is true to size for me (5’8”-170lb so a medium for me). Straps are really comfortable. Padding inside does have some loose edges all around that occasionally can be felt- not as great of a finish as shorts I have from Castelli.  I think they could have sewn the edges down better. I’ve only had them for a few weeks so I have no idea how they will wear. So far so good. Even the unsewn edges are not fraying so that’s good. I’d buy them again.
review.name: Great bibs

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bibs are quite a personal thing, but for this person, the Mille GT C2 are the best that Assos make.  I think the fact that this in reality has a thinner chamois than the GTS or Pearl Izumi Pro (both of which I own and like) hits the sweet spot for me.  Given that Assos does a floating pad which is only attached at the front and back, I do find it important to have the right size, though, and for me this means staying in the smallest logical size available.  With that dialed in properly these bibs are just sublime.


Compared to other bibs in the Assos range these are technically less feature rich, but oddly I find some of the elements to be even better than the higher end model.  The leg grippers on the GT, for example, are significantly more effective than the much pricier GTS.  I have to adjust the GTS mid-ride, but didn’t touch the legs on my GT bibs a single time even in 3+ hour sessions.  The bib straps are also terrific, with robust materials that provide good tension but are wide enough so that they never cut into your shoulders, and the waist band practically disappears onto your body.


All in all, these have quickly found their way to the top of my rotation despite owning Mille GTS, Pearl Izumi Pro, Giordana FR-C Pro, Giordana Silverline, and Endura Pro SL EGM bibs (among a smattering of others).  Suffice to say I’ve done my fair share of bib experimentation, and highly recommend the Mille GT C2s.  These absolutely punch above their weight and are superior to many other bibs at a higher price point…again, in my opinion.
review.name: Best Assos Yet

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comparing this to pearl azumi, specialized, etc, this pad is very uncomfortable. Thicker is actually less comfortable? Bunches up and pinches I think. Too bad. Rest of short is great.
review.name: Padding bunches up. Ouch!

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GT C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my first Assos purchase in several years and my first time trying their latest line. For reference, I thought the previous generation Assos bibs (pink chamois) were very good. This new GT bib has been great on my first few rides. I am very picky and had no issues on the design. Straps, chamois, and overall fit are quite comfortable. The new, wider straps lay flat and secure, and spread out the force so the straps don't bunch up. No pinch zones or chaffing with the 11mm GT chamois. The thickness is perfect for me. (I would suggest caution when choosing between these and the thicker 13mm chamois on the GTS, as in my experience, thicker chamois are not necessarily better and have more risk of bunching up, creating chaffing between legs and sides of saddle, or losing road feel.)
review.name: My new go-to bibs.

name: MILLE GT C2 Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Light weight glove that's perfect for XC and light trail riding in hot weather. The palm is perforated and the back is light weight too. I even use them indoors on the trainer and they're not hot. 

I have two pairs and both have held up, though the first pair seemed to have a few of the touch screen threads come unraveled, but I trimmed them with scissors and they've been fine. Both have held up to the washing machine. 

--light weight--Louisiana heat and humidity approved 
--durable
--dry quickly
--fairly stain resistant--they clean up well
review.name: Light and Durable

review.reviewBody: A very good light weight glove.  I am a sweaty individual and these were soaked and still had grip.  I will be getting another pair.
review.name: Nice and light

name: Trixter Glove - Men's

hasVariant.name: FlexMat Plus Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Exped FlexMat Plus Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I REALLY wanted to like this mat - and we got 2 for an upcoming short backpack in the UP of Michigan. The concept of more height AND width in a sleeping pad seems right on to deal with the cold and ergonomics. (Most of the foam sleeping pads out there are_ridiculously_narrow, @ 22" [I'm 6'1" and 200 lb.])  

BUT, test-sleep this pad - it's like lying on a bed of styrofoam (sorry, IXPE) nails! Quite uncomfortable. I mean, if you were completely and utterly dead-tired, then yes.  But anything less, and I think you would spend A LOT of precious sleep time on the trail convincing yourself you are comfortable, when in fact, you're truly not.

I'm sure there are those who would say to me, you're a princess from the princess and the pea fairy tale - nearly literally. ; p  But I do_not_think the majority of people that try using this sleeping pad will find it comfortable and therefore passable.

Again - cool design concept, but poor final execution.  Exped industrial designers, please keep refining this idea!
review.name: Sorry, but!

name: FlexMat Plus Sleeping Pad

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed Low ZT Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Girls'
review.reviewBody: Bought these for my son before a trip to Mt Rainier. He loved them out of the box- aesthetically as well as fit. Hiked 4-8 miles each day without any complaints or foot issues (no blisters!). Would buy again next year as he continues to grow.
review.name: Great
comment: Thank you for the amazing feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed Low ZT Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Girls'
review.reviewBody: I purchased these for my daughter for Christmas. She didn't really get to start eating them until after Christmas. The concept behind the shoe is great, and I wouldn't mind an adult pair. Sadly, this should didn't make it 5 months before it started to just fall apart on her feet. She started getting holes around the 2 month mark, but we just brushed it off. Don't get me wrong,  I absolutely love Merrell. This shoe just didn't make it.
review.name: Decent shoe
comment: We value your feedback and we'd love to help at 800-288-3124.

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed Low ZT Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Girls'
review.reviewBody: Our 6 year old loves her new Merrells   She loves them for hiking through the woods.  The grips are amazing.  She said she feels like a super hero wearing them.
review.name: Super hero shoes
comment: That's very awesome! Thank you for sharing!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed Low ZT Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Girls'
review.reviewBody: My son Went hiking in jungles of Belize and did excellent
review.name: Hiking shoes
comment: Thank you for the great review!

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed Low ZT Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Girls'
review.reviewBody: Son got them for Christmas, he really likes them and they've been pretty good. But after just two months the zipper fastener has broken on one of the shoes and he needs a new pair. Would steer clear of them for this reason.
review.name: Broken zipper piece
comment: We're sorry to hear this happened to you. We stand behind our products and we'd love to do all we can to help. We have a 1 year warranty on our products for any manufacturing defects. Please visit our ‘Contact Us’ page at the link below and fill out the Warranty Form to start a claim. If you need any assistance with the form give the team a call at 800-288-3124. Thank you. https://tinyurl.com/bdcuxst9

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed Low ZT Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Girls'
review.reviewBody: These have not held up as well as other designs — coming apart after 5 months (but the zip feature is still intact).
review.name: Just OK

review.itemreviewed: Moab Speed Low ZT Waterproof Hiking Shoe - Girls'
review.reviewBody: Excellent and durable shoes. Stylish looks and easy to tighten and loosen in a hurry
review.name: Great durable, waterproof trail shoes
comment: Thank you for the great review!

review.reviewBody: Nice shoes but wish they came in wides. The shoes fit but wides fit better

review.reviewBody: I have worn the Scarpa VSR's for a year and wanted to try a softer slipper. The shoe fits my foot pretty well compared to the VSRs. I got a 40.5 but definitely could have gone smaller. I would recommend 2-2.5 sizes smaller from street shoe; 1.5 if you want more comfort.
review.name: Cool and comfortable shoe-

review.reviewBody: These last significantly longer in the gym than my other La Sportiva shoes. They also perform well on a wide variety of holds and angles. Not the best for steep board climbing, but the other factors outweigh this attribute.
review.name: Long lasting gym shoe

review.reviewBody: the perfect shoe for people who don't like shoes....the barefoot shoe of the climbing world.   strong healthy feet are a must though,  don't expect any support.
review.name: la sportiva mantra climbing shoes

review.itemreviewed: Micro Floor Drive High Volume Pump
review.reviewBody: I bought this as my air pump when i fly with my bike.  The gauge is hard to read but it’s do-able.  It’s a small compact and light pump, it’s perfect for what I need it for, and I did pump up my tubeless tires without issue testing it.   If it holds up great, it’s a specific job purchase, so it’s doing what I need it to do.
review.name: Nice size for Air travel

review.itemreviewed: Micro Floor Drive High Volume Pump
review.reviewBody:
I loved the look and build quality of this pump, but the threaded attachment to the valve stem is problematic for tubeless setups. When threading the hose onto the valve stem, it?s possible to actually begin turning the valve stem ? this can actually unscrew the valve stem nut and let all the air out of valve stem hole. I don?t think this would be a problem for tubes, but I didn?t try it myself. 

I ended up returning it and going with a pump with a levered stem coupler.
review.name: Flawed for use tubeless stems

review.itemreviewed: Micro Floor Drive High Volume Pump
review.reviewBody:
Good quality tire pump.
The only complaint I have as the pump was in the mail, it went on sale for $20.00 cheaper=!
review.name: Good tire pump but disappointed
comment: Really you are giving a negative review because they cut the price?

review.itemreviewed: Micro Floor Drive High Volume Pump
review.reviewBody: The other day, I had the unfortunate trail side need for the Micro Floor Drive pump. The slightly longer body, the hose & the foot brace, all make it the best pack sized pump I've ever used. It pumped my tire back up with much less effort & is well worth the slight weight increase of a smaller pump.
review.name: Best trail pump I've used

review.itemreviewed: Micro Floor Drive High Volume Pump
review.reviewBody: Love the pump. The gauge is a fail IMHO - unless you have 200/20 vision, which I don't. I have purchased the same pump sans the gauge and bought a low PSI gauge for my Pugsley.
review.name: Good pump, horrible gauge - hard to read

name: Micro Floor Drive High Volume Pump

review.reviewBody: The V2 Carrier does not fit the V2 tool even if you remove the lower screw on component.   Poorly designed.  Took it to the dealer and he tried two different Threadless carriers and neither worked with the matching V2 tool.   Support from one up is non existent
review.name: Junk- Does not fit

review.reviewBody:
So this does not fit the full V2 EDC. The larger compartment on the bottom that holds a CO2 canister or other large item has to be completely removed in order for this to work. There is still a smaller internal compartment that could hold a couple plugs but that is it, won't even fit a plug tool.

This isn't mentioned anywhere in the tech specs, really frustrating.
review.name: Does not fit complete v2 EDC Tool!
comment: Thanks, agreed its really not obvious even if its hidden on the Oneup website.  I will get the tap install
Its stated on the web site and on plenty of YT videos..... you should had went with the threaded option
It is stated on the OneUp website

name: EDC V2 Threadless Carrier

review.reviewBody: As a family we are really into our bikes so we did loads of research into our little ones first bike! We are really pleased with our choice - the AIRO is really lightweight, its easy for our little one to manage on his own but still robust enough that it can take falling into the verge on the regular!! It actually looks amazing too! Would definitely recommend for biking families who want to get their child a high-quality first bike
review.name: Great lightweight first bike!

review.reviewBody:
Can you imagine if your mountain or road bike weighed nearly half as much as you? I imagine cycling wouldn't be nearly as popular as it is, if we had to struggle to push such heavy bikes every time we set out riding. This is what the groms have been dealing with for years and finally Hornit has come to market with a lightweight balance bike for this rowdy group of riders.

At 6.5lbs this balance bike is much lighter-weight than any other option on the market. This means your little one can get up to full speed much quicker than the other groms in the neighborhood. It also means they can stride for much longer without getting tired.

Compared to other products on the market this bike is much higher quality in just about every aspect. The frame is designed from magnesium in order to keep weight low, the tires are actual rubber and are filled with air just like your big rig. The overall design of the bike with a low-slung top tube, foot platforms, and quality cockpit components ensure that your little one is able to hop on and ride off without any obstructions. 

If you're looking for an excellent gift for your little one to start them off on a long path of cycling, this is the bike you're looking for.
review.name: Lightest-weight Balance Bike Available

name: Airo Balance Bike - Kids'

These pants are fantastic. The materials are some of the best for hiking and durability. With a base layer underneath, they will definitely help keep me warm.

I love all the features they have too, very well thought out design!
review.name: Fit and Function are Great!

review.reviewBody:
One sweet pair of pants!!! But… 
Needs a butt pocket…
review.name: Great but

review.reviewBody: Stop researching. Get these for hiking
review.name: Great pants

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants a month ago,and til now i’m very pleased with the pants. For summer adventures is it very usefull
review.name: Very stretchy pants

review.reviewBody: I replaced two pairs of worn-out old lighweight Fjallraven trousers with this newer design and couldn't be happier. They are form fitting, functional and fun to wear. I have worn one of the two pair everyday during my annual 30 Days of Dawn photo challenge, chasing sunrise every morning and these trousers perfomed perfectly. I added a lightweight baselayer for a few colder days but still maintained the great flexible feel these pants offer in spades. TOP NOTCH TROUSERS!
review.name: The Perfect Pant!

review.reviewBody: I've had roughly 3 pairs by now and will continue to buy them
review.name: Best Pants

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago and I’m very pleased. Have not yet how to use the wax. I booked trees, choker, set, work in the mountains, logging seven days a week 12 hour days. These pants have held off so far. I wish they had suspender buttons in the back.
review.name: Durability

review.reviewBody: I really wish these pants worked for me. The material combination is pretty brilliant, as the faced lowers and seat feel very durable and the stretch and breathability of the remainder of the pant is great. The main drawback to me is the fit. The pants are incredibly tight thru the thighs, crotch and seat, in relationship to the waist size of the pant. I am typically a men’s 36 or 38 waist depending on the pant and purchased a 38 in these to account for the tightness in the legs and seat. While the waist fit well, the legs and seats were just too snug for comfortable use so I ended up returning them. These are a great pant, but a relaxed version would improve the fit for some of us.
review.name: Material is Exceptional - Fit is not

review.reviewBody: Love these pants, very comfortable. Not bad in the heat and cold. Wear these pants to work every day. Very pricey and they don’t last as long as I would like but the comfort is worth it.
review.name: Only pants I wear

review.reviewBody: Great pant. Probably the best pants I have ever owned. I use these for elk hunting and my only complaint would be to have a true camo pattern offered in the lineup. The current camo pattern just doesn’t cut it. Also wouldn’t mind a 36” inseam.
review.name: Great pant- need a real camo pattern offering

review.reviewBody: My second pair of these shorts - still wearing my last pair going on 3 years now.  Medium fits perfect for me.  Form-fitting but not tight with a liner underneath.   140 pounds, 5'8''.    Fun bright green color.
review.name: happy with purchase

review.reviewBody: I love my new shorts and am especially gratefull for the customer assistance.
review.name: Navareh shorts purchase

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these recently because of how much I loved the shorter version. The black ones were on sale, I'm guessing now because they were an older model... They arrived appearing clean and new, but smelling.. old. Like they had been stored for a long time and with a distinct mildew smell. The adjustment velcro on the sides wasn't the same style as the ones I own in the shorter version (which are like the ones pictured, cloth straps with velcro sewed on)- instead they have harder plastic tabs with velcro on one side. This wouldn't be an issue, except that when I hand washed them before wearing the first time, the hard plastic immediatey split in multiple places, cracking and breaking apart, leaving only a couple millimeters of velcro left to latch on to adjust the waist, so the velcro doesn't stay in place with no grip.

I'm wondering if they'd been stored for a long time without humidity control? Or a storage box got rained on? Maybe the plastic is brittle bc of age? I don't know. Worth mentioning if anyone else gets that version.

I'm sewing replacement velcro straps onto them and wearing them because aside from that, the fit is great and they're comfy, and I don't want to waste them. The sizing is true to this brand (I'm between a M and L, and I consistently wear a L comfortably in Naveah shorts bc of the good snug waist adjustment). The length is great even though I have short legs, they keep a nice length over my knee pads.
review.name: Older version, brittle adjustment straps

review.reviewBody: This is not my first pair of Zoic Naveah shorts.  I have had this short in size L but now I've lost weight (yippee) and my large shorts are way too baggy.  So I purchased a pair of grey medium shorts which fit just great (I wear liner shorts underneath).  I especially love the abundance of secure zippered pockets on these shorts.  I wasn't too sure about the grey color as it looked a bit blue-ish on my computer screen, but it's actually a very nice color of grey.
review.name: Great shorts

name: Navaeh Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: Really nice fit and comfortable to wear. It is a bit hot but not really much more hot than wearing a base layer. Wore it on a pedal fest and it didn't flop around at all.
review.name: Nice pads

review.reviewBody:
I really like the baseframe pro SL for enduro style riding. It breathes very well on the front and sides, has solid protection and doesn't get super stinky if you rinse it after use. Hip pads were a great inclusion. 
I wish the back protection was a bit lower profile as it does stick out a bit more than my other low profile armor and it doesn't breath as well as it could so you'll get a sweaty back. It's a minor gripe though as it's still pretty slim.
I'm 6'1, 190lbs with a 45" measured chest so got the XL. Probably could have gone with the large.
review.name: Light and cool
comment: Good Review, a lot of info. Thanks

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Board looks amazing! Can't wait til it's warm enough to get out on it : )

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful board and very high quality finish and materials- looks amazing and can’t wait to try it out on the lake!
review.name: Waiting for next summer … board looks beautiful!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This board is such a great surprise. Super stable and also good for surfing. Love it.
review.name: Love this board!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am an avid paddle boarder and this is my 5th board I’ve purchased and first BOTE board. I love the length as it makes turns easily and swiftly. The board feels super comfortable and I love all the d rings. The only issue with BOTE boards is the heavy weight of the boards. This board is their lightest at 31lbs but still feels heavy and thick when getting it up in my SUP rack. I never liked how thick all the boards are which makes these boards so heavy that 2 people are needed to get them up on vehicles.
review.name: Breeze is swift but boards are still too thick.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I will admit I was pretty nervous about ordering a paddleboard online because of freight shipping and everything. The process was so much easier than I could’ve ever dreamed and my board arrived in perfect condition!
review.name: Breeze 10”6 hard Paddleboard

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these boards. Wish we’d gotten them years ago.
review.name: Very pleased!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product. A lot of fun
 Very sturdy, lightweight, easy to use.
review.name: Lightweight Sturdy SUP

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The bote board I got works great
review.name: The bote board I got

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow! I havent purchased a new board in many years, and have never had a Bote board. An incredible experience from start to finish. Unbeatable deal. Solid board that floats and paddles through our lake with the greatest of ease. Love the all-inclusive package with leash and fin and even a PFD belt. AWESOME! You cannot beat the value for the money. Also, shipping was super easy. Great freight company who took care of the board. Box arrived in great shape. They have clearly worked hard on their process and the customer experience and it shows. Dont hesitate, pull the trigger and get a Bote board.
review.name: Awesome Experience and Board!

review.reviewBody: Something definitely changed from the first 3 versions. They were so comfortable. These are tight and narrow. They feel like a pair of Nike shoes. I actually bought two pair but I definitely plan on returning them. Please go back to the old style. Especially version 2 or 3. I know that I bought at least 8 to 10 pairs of those. I wear a size 14 and they feel like a 12.5.
review.name: If it isn't broke don't try to fix it

review.reviewBody: If i could give a negative star i would. I had these on for less than 2 hours before my back began to spasm from the awkward sole of the shoe, took them off and put on a different pair of hoka. I have the Clifton 9's they are phenomenal spasm stopped immediately. These RINCONS are absolute garbage.
review.name: Worst shoe i've ever worn

review.reviewBody: Ordered these shoes for my son and it said they wouldn't ship till 10/1 and I actually got them in the next week!!
review.name: Definitely would buy again.

review.reviewBody: I've been waiting for the new Rincon 4 for months and immediately bought them when they came out. The thing I loved about the Rincon was the ample toe box and cushion. The Rincon 4 lacks this and is very confining to the point of being painful. I didn't feel it until a mile or two in and now I can't wear them.
review.name: Not a Rincon

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight, EVA Midsole & Outsole give just the right bounce back, very stable, and Mesh is very Cool & Comfortable. Great Walking Shoe couldn't be happier with the Feel and Fit. Thanks again to the entire HOKA TEAM.
review.name: RINCON 4 GREAT WALKING SHOES

review.reviewBody: The sole feels like a cheap plastic and I slid around during HIIT workouts on the gym floor.
review.name: So slippery on the gym floor

review.reviewBody: Still a great light weight shoe for walking and running
review.name: Rincon 4 has become an adult shoe from Rincon 3

review.reviewBody: Been wearing Rincons for years, but the Rincon 4 is different and not in a good way, at least for me. The sole design was changed with a split center design and been causing new heel pain. Maybe its my stride, but never was an issue with previous Rincon 2 or 3 models where sole was solid and smoother. Wish they would bring back Rincon 3 style as was my go to every day runner and racer when needed. Thumbs down on the Rincon 4. I will try the Mach model as they recommended
review.name: Why Change a Good Thing

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a gift for my son. I've been wearing Hokas for years, so when he saw his friends wearing them he requested a pair for his birthday.
review.name: Did not disappoint, my son was so happy.

review.reviewBody: I think I found my new favorite brand of shoe first time I put them on. I could not believe how comfortable they were but once I actually started wearing them at work my feet hurt like crazy walking on the concrete took about 2 to 3 days to break them in but once the shoes were broken in unbelievable how comfortable they are.
review.name: I think I found my new favorite brand

name: Rincon 4 Running Shoe - Men's
