review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket to replace another Columbia jacket I've had for over a decade. The other jacket was fine except for getting too close to a firepit.
review.name: I bought this jacket to replace another

review.reviewBody: Very nice jacket, looks great....it feels well made. I ordered a large, but it was too tight on me, so i'll gift it to my son for Christmas. I reordered one in XL.
review.name: Men's Hikebound™ II Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s a Christmas gift that was very specific. 👍🏾
review.name: Requested Christmas gift looks great, feels great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you’re looking for a water proof jacket that wont break a bank this is it…i got it on sale too…(black friday) the definition for this jacket is downpour…yup…so from downpour down to light rain…no problem…
review.name: Water proof jacket…its a deal…

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Raingear is funny. Usually you get more wet from sweat from a supposedly breathable clothing than you get from penetrating rain. My last Hikebound-style jacket remained usable for over 8 years without any of that. Unfortunately it seems to have shrunk so I needed a larger size. I expect this to perform as well. This is not guide-gear, nor is it half as expensive. This is simply good performance gear for price
review.name: Great performance regardless of price

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality jacket. This is the second one that I purchased.  Ideal for hiking in all types of weather.
review.name: Great hiking jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have bought this jacket for my husband a couple times. Perfect for layering and keeping dry. Price is much lower than other brands with similar specs. Runs true to size. Wears well. Don’t waste your time shopping around. If you’re looking for a waterproof jacket, you’ve found it.
review.name: Perfect lightweight waterproof jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this for my husband and he loves it. Good quality. He likes to usually wear sweaters underneath his jackets so it’s roomy.
review.name: Husband loves it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] If you’re in need of a dependable raincoat that strikes a great balance between waterproof protection and breathability. It’s durable, lightweight, and comfortable, making it suitable for a wide range of outdoor activities. Highly recommended for those looking for practical rain protection.
review.name: Great!

name: Hikebound II Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: So comfy, I just wish there were a lot more colors and choices with the sandal.
review.name: Everyone needs this sandal.

review.reviewBody: I am old and have painful feet, including toes. These feel wonderful with a pair of soft, thin socks (think the old "Buster Brown's"), and almost as good barefoot. It's the fleece lining inside that makes the difference. My regular shoe size is women's size 7 1/2 & I order these in size 8. Perfect! I went on to purchase them in every color!
review.name: Best "shoes" ever (with socks); best sandals without socks!

review.reviewBody: My slippers...I needed a firmer shoe with the comfort of a slipper...my second pair, I can wear them anywhere!
review.name: I would and have bought my 2nd pair.

review.reviewBody: Wears well for a week (daily indoor use only). House is clean, as well as the floors. House slipper/sandal household, so no dirty shoes worn in the house. The software inner lining wears down quickly and looks beaten and mangy. Sadly, it was a wasted gift for my mom and she didn't want to tell me.
review.name: Concept and look is right, but doesn't wear well.

review.reviewBody: Very cozzy, I never had a pair of sandals like this one.
review.name: Maybe, different color, and my size.

review.reviewBody: These are curious, not sure why they have 2-3 inch thick sole but, this results in a platform sandal. I have rolled my ankles in these around the house an absurd number of times considering this has never happened with any other sandal, ever, I stopped wearing them. I wish the product description explained in detail that the sole is 2-3 thick, and I would never have purchased these.
review.name: Buy if you enjoy dangerous high-heel sandals

name: Classic Cozzzy Sandal

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a full cover for storage but this will work fine
review.name: Was looking for a full

review.reviewBody: Easy to use, fits great, and love the convenient fold away pack bag! We live in Denver where the weather can change unexpectedly and having the rain cover stored right on top of the carrier is so helpful!
review.name: Fits great, convenient pack away

review.reviewBody: I have not had the opportunity to use because of the lack of rain in my geographical location, but I am glad I have it just in case.
review.name: What Rain?

review.reviewBody: So easy to pop up and down! I often ride one way to work so being able to get it into the car quickly is key. Plus, it fits perfectly in our camper van to take on long distance trips with the dog. Simple conversion from trailer to jogger helped us train the dog to ride. So quick to attach and remove from the bike. Love all the air flow for him, the bed, and the ability to completely enclosed him when riding in high traffic areas. Customer service rocks. My dog is only 70lbs but he is long so this model is the only one that gives him the space he needs. Can’t say enough good things about this trailer!
review.name: Love my Bark Ranger!

review.reviewBody: The rain cover is a must for me. It is important to me to keep my dog and the inside of the trailer dry.
review.name: A must

review.reviewBody:
This carbon steel pan is a great size for two people and is built with the expected Snow Peak  quality. It can be used with the large grill bridge as well as the new Takibi Solo and, of course, on any stove or grill you might have. 

As it is carbon steel you will need to burn off the coating and then season and care for it like any other carbon, but it is really very well season from the get go.

I talk about them in a recent Youtube review attached so you can see the size and see it being cooked on.
review.name: A Great Cooking Surface

description: Buy the Troy Lee Designs T-Bone Knee Guard online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: T-Bone Knee Guard
hasVariant.description: Buy the Troy Lee Designs T-Bone Knee Guard online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: T-Bone Knee Guard
hasVariant.description: Buy the Troy Lee Designs T-Bone Knee Guard online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I normally wear medium sized pads but I actually had to size down on these because I had to fully extend the straps to fit and I was worried it could slip. I've had G-form and Fox slip on style knee pads and they slip down a lot during a ride and it's annoying, also they don't hold up very well on bigger crashes . First wore these on the Whole Enchilada and these TLD T-Bone pads has straps that definitely helps prevent slipping and I don't even notice these pads during a climb. Has decent padding on strategic parts of the knee. Really liking these knee pads so far.
review.name: Great Pads

review.reviewBody:
This is my second pair of T Bones and I swear by them. My last pair has been going strong (because I fall a LOT) for two years now...

The only thing to be advised about is washing. Close the straps all the way to fully cover the Velcro on both pads before you throw into the wash! My last pads had to have the Velcro replaced because it wouldn?t stick anymore and I?ve gotten much smarter now.

After some time, they will smell even if you wash them...it?s the name of the game. Bath water and baking soda did the trick.

Will never wear different pads!!
review.name: These save my ass!
comment: Lacey W for the smell use a hockey pad wash trick pour a cup of white vinegar in the wash problem solved.

review.reviewBody: These offer good protection in a lightweight easy to pedal package.  The straps don?t bind and they don?t shimmy down or bunch up.  Like them so much I even use them for skateboarding.
review.name: Knee pads you don?t think about

review.reviewBody: After purchasing several sets of pads for my son I finally found one that isn’t so bulky. He was getting bruised bad on inside of knees while riding and these were the perfect solution
review.name: Great knee pads

name: T-Bone Knee Guard

review.itemreviewed: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: These are the perfect shoes for my wild 2 year old. He's always on the move - climbing, jumping, falling and these shoes keep him safe. They have a lot of grip on the bottom so I'm not worried about him slipping. They're great for all of our hot weather adventures whether it's kayaking or a day at the splash pad. He also wears these out on the trail. We throw them on with socks so his feet stay breezy but they're protected from mosquitos.
review.name: Perfect for Wild Toddlers

review.itemreviewed: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Great sandal for our 13 month old grandson who is walking. Easy to put on flexible for beginner walker. Overall very pleased
review.name: Great sandal for beginner walker.

review.itemreviewed: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: My 1.5year old toddler loves his new sandals. He tries to put them on himself and calls them “pretty”. They’re lightweight but robust. Perfect for the summer weather. I’ve not washed them yet but I hope they hold their colour because they look great.
review.name: BrIght and comfy

review.itemreviewed: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: These sandals are wonderful! Our boy has used them for two weeks to do the Camino de Santiago and they are the perfect brake for his balance bike, walking, kicking the ball and playing in the river. We have washed them and they are like new.
review.name: Amazing sandals!

review.itemreviewed: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: These have been great sandals for our adventurous 15 month old daughter. She’s played in sprinklers and climbed mountains with them. Very easy to get off and on and very cute to boot!
review.name: Awesome for a super mobile 15mo girl

review.itemreviewed: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Great shoe investment, I have wanted to buy a pair for my daughter for a while and I am so glad I finally did! She loves them, will wear them all day and even calls them her favorite shoe! We put them to the test hiking and lake swimming and so far they have held up great!
review.name: Great Sandel

review.itemreviewed: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: He loves wearing these shoes. I love them because they are super cute on his little foot and easy for him to put on and take off.
review.name: My little guy loves these shoes

review.itemreviewed: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Seem to be comfortable right out of the box. She says she can run “super fast” wearing them. Happy kid. Happy mom. Definitely worth the investment.
review.name: She loves them!

review.itemreviewed: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: These are the best summer shoes. I’ve wasted so much money trying to find “cheaper” toddler sandals and sneakers. So glad I’ve found these. Easy to put on, true to size, comfortable, and great grip for running and playing.
review.name: Love these

review.itemreviewed: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: These are amazing little sandals for toddlers/young kids! I love that they are closed toe and they have an actual heel and they aren’t like a sling back sandal. My daughter has hyper mobility in her ankles which makes her prone to falling a lot so these sandals do a great job at keeping her feet protected while still offering the lightweight feel and breathability that you typically are looking for in a sandal! Love that they are machine washable too!
review.name: Buy them!

name: Seacamp II CNX Sandal - Toddler Boys'

description: Buy the Thule Artificial Rain Gutter - 4-pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Artificial Rain Gutter - 4-pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Artificial Rain Gutter - 4-pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I installed these on my truck topper so I'd have a straightforward roof rack install. I installed a set of Thule Pro Roof Rack Bars which are rated for higher duty than typical bars . I have put these raingutters through the worst abuse over many years of reliable ownership. Adding and removing lumber, loading roof baskets to the max, or traveling across states with my paddleboards, I've never had a second thought that my rain gutters or my Thule pro rack wasn't going to hold up. Highly recommend these for a simplified rack install on your truck topper, van or trailer. Simplicity, durability, perfection.
review.name: Sturdy and will last foreverrrrr!

review.reviewBody: Plan on repainting or powder coating these. I ordered 3 set and each and every piece has chunks of paint missing from them. The quality of these have gone down hill immensely.
review.name: Horrible paint quality

review.reviewBody:
Very handy item to fit common Rain Gutter Towers on your camper shell, RV or whatever so you can mount roof bars, racks, boxes, Roof Top Tents or whatever. This will be the second time around for me, as I will again be mounting 4 of these Thule Artificial Rain Gutters on my second VW Rialta Winnebago RV. Then onto Yakima Round Bar towers, and I will use 1" galvanized pipe to save beaucoup bucks on roof bars. 

I will be carrying two canoes again, and after thousands of miles over numerous trips, the Thule Artificial Rain Gutters have my confidence.

Big props to the great folks at Backcountry, working hard to help us get into the wilds with safe gear that also provides a measure of comfort. Special props to the young gentleman who helped me tonight, sorry but too old to remember your name for more than a moment.

Be good to each other my friends, and be well.
review.name: Thule Artificial Rain Gutter GOOD!

name: Artificial Rain Gutter - 4-pack

description: Buy the Salomon Bonatti Waterproof Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Bonatti Waterproof Jacket - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Bonatti Waterproof Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Bonatti Waterproof jacket in green for men and it quickly became my "Go To" Rain Jacket. I purchased this one in blue for my wife before our trip to Italy.  It was a torrential downpour in Venice upon our arrival.  We got lost in the winding streets of Venice for more than an hour. This jacket kept me totally dry.
review.name: Go to Rain Jacket
comment: Hi. Thank you for sharing your feedback with us. We’re happy to know that you love your new Salomon jackets! Enjoy Italy!

review.reviewBody: This is the third Bonatti waterproof I have bought over the years. It keeps the rain out very well, but I find that perspiration builds up inside the jacket sleeves when I am running. The hood design has been changed slightly this time, and it drops forward a bit too far over my eyes. I preferred the previous hood.
review.name: Good running waterproof

review.reviewBody: Pros: I like the light weight, slim fit which is true to size, three storage pockets, water proof, and color.  Cons: I do not find this to be breathable, I sweat in this jacket.  The like the pockets, but the zipper pulls are so small they get stuck inside the material.  I also, do not like the crunchy sound that the fabric makes.  Overall I rate it good, not very good or excellent.
review.name: Good jacket

review.reviewBody: Needed a rain jacket to handle strong winds with a lot of rain. Love it, I’ve used it for a few of my long runs (3+ hour runs) in the rain and wind (gusts to 30+mph) and it held up beautifully. I was warm and comfortable (as much as you can be) the whole time. The jacket didn’t feel restrictive in my movements, and I wore my hydration pack over it. And it felt breathable to me. The hood was perfect, tight enough to stay on, but not so tight that it felt restrictive. Overall, would recommend for strong winds or light to downpour rainy conditions.
review.name: Rain Jacket for Ultra/Trail Runs

review.reviewBody: This jacket worked out great. I wore it for a marathon then again in Japan in the rain. Very comfortable.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: Love that this jacket is waterproof and lightweight! For me, it’s ideal for running in wet conditions.
review.name: Great features!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is on my mandatory packing list for any serious adventure where it might rain or snow.  I’ve used it for the Moab 240 and a snowy R3.  It’s quite literally a life saver.  Solomon also fixed the one thing I wished for in my old version => they added pockets.
review.name: A MUST HAVE

name: Bonatti Waterproof Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Poor quality materials and even worse construction. To put it another way, real junk.
review.name: Sent them back!

review.reviewBody:
Compared to Fly Racing gloves, these have the same problems I have with most gloves - the fingers are too long.  The glove is soft and stretchy enough so I can scoot the fabric tighter onto my fingers.  The Fly Racing gloves, on the other hand, can be pulled on without any fuss and I can just go!

The quality seems good. I got these for 50% off. I think full price is way too much considering the fit and feel are just merely okay.  I don't see any features to justify the full price
review.name: Generic fit

review.reviewBody: I have a lot of gloves, but his is my go to every ride. Super nice palm. Really comfortable.
review.name: This glove is awesome!

review.reviewBody: BEAutiful hat...real bad boy west wide brim Stetson...the brand alone says quality, durability, style. Be aware and order size up from chart. I was easily med based on Stetson AND Backcountry size chart but had return, reorder large which is just perfectly tight...right amount of room for break in stretch...been week now and just starting to fit as desired...another week and will be daily comfortable fit. My head is 22.75 in and mef hat measured exactly 22 in inside...too small to try and stretch...broken in with front and back downward fold with stiff straight sides....my preference, but could have left straight flat all round and still looks like old west gunslinger like best spaghetti western. Go Stetson or go home.
review.name: Classic AND classy

name: JW Marshall Hat

review.reviewBody: I think this is my 3rd pair. I wear them for about a year or 2 till completely worn out. Warm & comfortable.
review.name: My favorite

review.reviewBody: I bought these a couple of months ago and really like them.  My feet were always cold because of neuropathy and thick socks always were to tight to be comfortable.  These are light weight yet nice and warm.  The fit was accurate.
review.name: Nice and warm

review.reviewBody:
I have had a pr. of these for years & have been homebound due to an injury to my spine.
I still get around pretty good.I live in VT. & the power is questionable at best. I have already experienced frostbite in my left foot(no power for 4 days) it was 32 degrees in the house!
I got these booties after that but these would have prevented the frostbite: Especially paired with the warmest socks made (alpaca) then comfort + comfort= super warm & comfy.
This is my 2nd pr., just a backup since they seem to go up every year & I like the color!
I have worn this 1st pr. for 3-4 yrs, daily for 6 months/yr. & they  have been beat on by me! Just how I move around the house & have gone out front to get a box or help w/ a food delivery & they have no signs of wear! Get a pr. you won't be disappointed .
review.name: Indestructible ! A Warm & comfy booty

review.reviewBody: Fit well, wore well. Wore them to death! Ordering a new pair this year. I always order a size larger due to my swelling feet. Ignore my height & weight!
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: These booties are some tuff Kicks for the outdoors. I've hammered on mine for 2 seasons now in Alaska glaciers and they are Bomber! Well thought of and well made!
review.name: Bomberproof

name: Standard Down Bootie - Men's

review.reviewBody: I ordered this coat and was super stoked! Upon arrival all checked out and was great. Upon tightening up the hood, the drawstring immediately ripped out of the actual coat. I decided I wanted to return that one for being faulty and get a new one. The second one came in and I did not have that problem. The only issue this one has is that along all of the seams you can see the feathers from inside the coat. All in all, I don't think this coat is made super well. It is warm and I will keep this last one most likely but in general I'm not overwhelmed with happiness by this purchase. I would not recommend based on the above.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody:
I am so happy with my new Backcountry Stansbury down jacket. It is incredibly warm - I tried it on in my house and within 10 minutes I was overheating. This jacket is warm! I have gotten so many compliments on the pattern (I got the Desert Stone Pink colorway) and the cut of the jacket. 

Sizing: I am on the border of a small and medium depending on the style of jacket and cut. I ended up keeping the Small in this jacket. It's a little oversized, and I could have fit in the medium, but I liked how the sleeves hit my wrists really well on the small and the shoulders were the perfect width. I can still wear a sweater under it - the style is boxy and it really works for winter fits. 

I purchased this to have a more "fashion forward" winter jacket for walking the dog, riding my bike, and skiing on sunny days. I think it will end up being more than that - it works very well as a technical jacket to stuff in my touring pack on cold days.
review.name: So Warm, So Comfy!

review.reviewBody: I only wish I would have more chance to use it! It's been pretty warm here along Colorado's front range since I bought this jacket. But I did have a chance to wear it snowshoeing one time and it was amazing...not too warm, but definitely warm enough and it was very easy to move in. I bought a medium so I'd have room for a sweater or fleece underneath but I don't need those. Still, I like the length of the medium. It's just a bit longer than the one on the model. Great jacket at a great price and it arrived quickly.
review.name: Great Fit, Very Warm

review.reviewBody: Needed a new winter coat and this one checks all the boxes. It’s currently -15 in Montana and after shoveling I’m still warm! Recommend and sizing is accurate
review.name: Warm

review.reviewBody: Love this sling bag when wading in waist deep waters or higher and when out in the rain. It is not bulky, nor heavy. The outside zippered pocket is not waterproof, so I keep anything that needs to be dry in plastic bags. I did purchase the compartment system for better organization of my gear. I only wish it was included already, especially for the price...hence the 4/5 stars.
review.name: My go-to bag when wading deep

review.reviewBody:
Overall, this pack performs incredibly well. I feel that of all the waterproof fishing bags out there, Fishpond has the most durable, and the most secure zipper. The drawback is that it can be tough to open and close because the zipper works so well. You definitely have to pay attention and keep the zipper lubricated.

The only actual downside is the internal storage or lack thereof. If you buy this pack, you will need to get the insert that Fishpond sells, or everything will loosely move around in the pack. Once you have this, it's a stellar pack and my choice for carrying everything you need for a day on the water.
review.name: Great pack, once you add some extras!

review.reviewBody: I was really surprised at the quality decline from HH. Much better options out there for less.
review.name: Super cheap quality.

review.reviewBody: Jacket is great quality. Heard it ran a bit small so I ordered a medium (I am usually a medium/small) and it fits great. Excited to test it this season
review.name: Very excited for this ski season

review.reviewBody:
At first glance jacket is high quality HH as one can expect. 

After getting it and trying it on I noticed the only usable pockets are the vents.... Exactly what you'd probably use on a warm day so that makes them NOT pockets.

Theres a tiny front pocket that can fit a 2010 iPhone or but nothing larger.

No inside pockets

Its rather bizarre honestly. Not sure who at HH designed this but every other shell jacket I've looked at has some usable pockets. Total miss on what would have been am awesome shell otherwise. Sending mine back.

If you really want this jacket and have to carry things I'd reccomend a chest/runners pouch underneath or over it.
review.name: Great materials - terrible design

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to like this jacket. The fit was good, and the quality seemed high from first glance. In fact I really liked the hood helmet compatibility and how much face coverage there is when fully zipped. 

But, the pocket layout just doesn't work. There is one "insulated" chest pocket, not two as the description above seems to state. And the only hand pockets are in the chest, not low on the hips where you would expect them. Those chest pockets also act as your ventilation on warm days. No actual dedicated pit zips
review.name: Not enough pockets

Buy the Thule Enroute Camera 20L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Enroute Camera 20L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Enroute Camera 20L Backpack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Great quality and look, the right size and function, but there are some sad deficiencies that prevent me from using it on day-to-day basis. It is going to be just a travel bag when I need to carry both my small laptop and camera (which being packed both, do not fit very well either).

1.  Zippers are to tight, good to prevent pickpocketing, but other than that, quite inconvenient.

2. Camera compartment is too big for mid- or small mirrorless like Olympus OM. Even with large Por lens mounted, it is still too large. And it really doesn't' work well with a laptop in the back pocket. Not for the daily use.

3. Camera compartment lid does not open well. Once again, good against thieves, but what about myself?

Overall, I would not recommend it to a friend, unless they need a stylish backpack just to pass through the airports with all the computer and compact camera stuff packed in one piece (my use case).
review.name: Good idea, not the best implementation.

review.reviewBody: Would love to see the inside of this backpack before buying it..
review.name: Inside Pics

review.reviewBody:
Small backpack for hiking w a camera.  

PROs: Lower price, good construction materials, and stiching,  Very thick padding for camera gear.  Bright green interior makes it easy to spot dark components in low light.  Comfortable and with cross chest strap, very stable.  Shoulder straps are very comfortable and thick.

CONs: Camera compartment is small and additional inserts are a weird shape and do not allow even a medium sized MFT camera + two medium sized zoom lenses.  For me not an issue since I will have the camera + one lens attached to a chest clip, but if you are hoping to carry a lot fo gear in just the camera compartment they better be smaller lenses.

BETTER if: it would be nice to have some attch loops on the outside.  Would be nice to have straps at teh bottom to allow attachment of small tripod (so water bottle can be carrier in side pouch.)
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Really a pretty decent bag but not quite perfect. The bulky"camera packing cube" makes the bag lopsided and the oragami inserts in it don't fit perfectly.
review.name: great but not perfect

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for a bag like this for 2 years and now I'm so happy I have something that's works great for me!!!
review.name: Love love love

name: Enroute Camera 20L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Ordered my regular size S, fits well and the stretch is nice for mobility during transitions and uphill skin.
review.name: Nice for inbounds and touring

review.reviewBody: Bibs rule! These bibs fit great, love the long zipper and high bin. Adjustable shoulder straps lets you dial in the fit. All around great pant
review.name: Recon stretch bibs

review.reviewBody: This bib is my favourite of my ski pants to wear. A little pricey but worth the incredible quality. Layered properly, they are impenetrable and yet breathable and light at the same time. Love the large pockets and velcro closures on the straps. They were a little tricky during bathroom breaks at first, but I figured out my technique and I’m in and out in minutes. I’m 5’6” and 125lbs so a size small was a perfect fit with and without much layering. I would suggest a size up if using it with multiple or “puffer” style, insulated mid layers.
review.name: Favourite ski pants

review.reviewBody: These bibs are super comfy and lightweight, and also stretchy but still totally waterproof! I’m 5’6” and 150 lbs and a medium fits perfect. Have worn these for many days both touring and riding inbounds. Really functional pockets, especially the beacon pocket. Also very quick and easy to use the side zip for bathroom breaks.
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: I’ve been looking for bibs that fit my curvy figure for a while now. Most brands don’t accommodate my hips well. ( 46” hips , 32 “‘waist , height 5 ‘ 10” )These are perfect!! I wish BD would come out with a drop seat in this style !
review.name: Finally

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these bibs. They are my favorite and go-to pants. The waterproof rating stands up to its name -- keeping me dry on those damp days. The four way stretch keeps the fit relaxed and not restricted. The material moves so great with you whether it's uphill or downhill. I can't recommend these bibs enough
review.name: Great fit, waterproof and flexible

review.reviewBody: Sick pants. fit well. like the adjustable straps. wee bit expensive
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: Amazing bibs! Fit is great with a perfect amount of stretch. I’m 5’5, 145lbs and wear a medium. Shell design works great for lift laps at the resort and also backcountry touring. Love the extra roomy pockets, especially the beacon pocket.
review.name: Super comfy and functional!

review.reviewBody: Great material and color. They fit as well as bibs could. Love the zipper down the side. Wore these in crazy winds and they held up well
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: Great pair of bibs! Lots of good pockets and the straps are easily adjustable. These are going to be a great piece for both resort skiing and backcountry adventures. I'm 5'6" and 130lbs--ordered my usual size small, but am exchanging for an XS, as it's just a little baggier of a fit than I was hoping for.
review.name: Great pair of bibs! Lots

name: Recon Stretch Bib Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’m 6’4” 199-203 lb. on average with 35” inseam and 36” waist. I also own the same bibs in blue but in size large. The XL fit a touch looser, but still provide ample compression and for you tall guys with thinner legs they will hug your quads down to the knee. Honestly best fitting bibs I have hands down. Will be great for long rides since the padding is plush but not too much in my opinion. Well worth the extra dollars. The exterior has a soft finish like suede or flannel and they do show a bit of dirt when they get dirty, but who cares when the fit is great and you’re busting your butt knocking out miles and vertical.
review.name: Great bibs- super comfy!

review.reviewBody: Amazingly comfortable with great compression. I’ve replaced all my bibs with Velocio products
review.name: Great Cycling Shorts

name: LUXE Bib Short - Men's

hasVariant.name: Alpine Nesting Bowl
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Alpine Nesting Bowl online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love the Alpine nesting bowls and plates! Easy to clean and durable for car camping, and they just look cool.
review.name: Love em!

review.reviewBody: I keep a few extras of these in my kitchen as they also make great bowls for everyday use. The sticker/label that it comes with leaves behind a residue that takes a couple washes in the dishwasher to remove, but I would still repurchase as they're very practical.
review.name: I keep a few extras

review.reviewBody: Love these bowls. I use them in my kitchen when not camping. Perfect size for cereal snacking. Plus, super easy to clean.
review.name: Not just for camping

review.reviewBody: Solid bowls! I originally bought 4 for car camping and they nest perfectly inside of my 4 person alpine set. I liked their simplicity/ durability so much that I decided to score 6 more to throw in the cupboard after my little ones seem to break all of our ceramic bowls. Highly recommended!
review.name: Solid nesting bowls

review.reviewBody: Perfect size. Excellent durability. We replaced all our household glass and plastic bowls with these. We are a family of 7 :-)
review.name: Best Bowl ever.

review.reviewBody: Good size, not too heavy, stack well, very useful.
review.name: Good size, not too heavy,

review.reviewBody: After boiling some tortellinis for 2' in this bowl on a low heat on a Primus Omnifuel stove on gas, the bottom has started to have a bending towards ""concave"" and therefore flips back and forth with a popping sound. Expected a bit better quality stainless steel for the price paid!
review.name: Bottom flips back and forth after using on a Primus Omnifuel

review.reviewBody: These bowls are sturdy, lightweight and easy to clean. Used on a 2 week backpacking trip and was very pleased.
review.name: Ideal backpacking bowls

review.reviewBody: This bowl can hold my breakfast; and, in a pinch, I can boil water in it...or use it as a no trace fire bowl. I can also clang it when dinner is ready, or use it to bake dessert. It'll also last a million years :)
review.name: Versatile Bowl

review.reviewBody: Ok bowls but with the thin lightweight design they are NOT STURDY, at all. They bend very easily - great for our car-camping box because we can stack 6 in the space of 1 regular bowl but for backpacking they BEND VERY EASILY - we would like to return ours...
review.name: NOT STURDY - BEND VERY EASILY

name: Alpine Nesting Bowl

hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Vantage Endless Promise 20L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Great backpack from an organization and design standpoint. I felt like there was just enough organization but not too much. I could have used an extra stash pocket up top like the 26L version but not a make or break. Shoulder straps are crazy comfortable - never felt anything like it. Great size and feels like it fits more than 20L bc of the versatility of that outside pocket.

My main gripe is the weight and the reason I couldnt' stick with it is the weight. It is way too heavy (almost 3lbs) for a 20L backpack esp for a petite person. If they are able to cut the weight in half or even 1/3 I would love to have it!
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: I've now had this pack for about 3 months and I'm thoroughly pleased with the Vantage. I needed a replacement for my university backpack that was genuinely comfortable and could fit lots of gear. I can fit my full-sized laptop, charger, 3 books, pen case, several headphones, keys, wallet, water bottle, food, lab equipment, and a change of clothes all in my daily use setup, and the pack remains comfortable. I think the only personal preference adjustments I'd like to see are a fully unzipping laptop section on the right side, and a buckle for the front flap snap instead of the hook. These do not inhibit the current function of the backpack, it would just make it a little more user friendly for day-to-day hurried use. I love the color, the insane amount of pockets, and the red pull tab for the inner top pocket. Seriously, I love this thing!
review.name: Comfortable and versatile!

review.reviewBody: I was stoked to see NEMO add backpacks to their lineup. For me, it checks all the boxes, comfortable, laptop compartment, organization, and eco friendly. My previous pack was bigger and expanded further from the back and leveraged the weight against me when standing. One thing to note, if you have a 15.6" laptop, get the next pack size up, This pack has helped me ditch the excess junk I carried around before and is much more streamline in size and fit.
review.name: The go to daily backpack

review.reviewBody:
I own this and the 30L version.  I've been primarily using the 30L model for daily use but my teenage daughter has been using the 20L version.  She loves the front open pocket and usually holds a jacket or quick access items there.  She has used it to hold a pair of shoes and, while tight, does fit.  

The organization and build quality is great.  The reason she uses this bag and not me comes down to size.  I take a laptop and ipad to work everyday.  While those both fit in here, the fit becomes a bit tight for my purposes.  Overall, a great bag and build quality.  I highly recommend this bag if your carry needs are on the smaller side.
review.name: High Quality and Comfortable

review.reviewBody: As with almost all of Nemo's products this thing was well thought out and even better executed.  The materials are top notch and the craftmanship is outstanding. The design not only looks the part but plays the part. I have recommended this bag to many friends, most of which informed me that they'd be purchasing.
review.name: Fit/Finish/Feel are near perfect.

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Vantage 20L for approximately a month as a commuting and travel pack. It fits my enormous MacBook Pro 16" and still protects it due to the suspended interior pocket. The recyclable materials were a big selling point for me and I find them to be really high quality; they're soft and quiet yet appear very durable. My only complaint about the pack is that there isn't a bottle holder and while I've had packs with poorly designed (too narrow, too loose) holders I appreciated being able to modify to have my beverage at hand. I have added a carabiner to the front interior expansion pocket to hold my water bottle but have to throw the coffee cup inside. I like the stealth valuables pocket, it will be handy for big city travel. Thanks NEMO for making this fabulous and low-impact pack!
review.name: Love this pack!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag about a month ago and love it. Well designed with many useful pockets, and the secret pocket is a great place to stash a water bottle for easy access (and it doesn't fall out)
review.name: Fantastic bag, love the pockets

review.reviewBody: I’m a remote worker and this bag has been great carrying my work gear to various coffee shops. Sits snug and comfortable on my shoulders. Love the color and the compartments for organizing all my gadgets. I know this isn’t what most people will be considering when purchasing the Vantage, but I find the versatility is a big factor in that it can double as an urban bag as well as for the outdoors.
review.name: Beautifully functional. Functionally beautiful.

review.reviewBody: I have been using the Vantage 20L as my commuting to work backpack, and it is everything that I need in a backpack. It organizes and protects all my work essentials and looks good on the train, street, and in the office.
review.name: Outstanding Backpack

review.reviewBody: Hands down the coolest daypack / citypack I've ever owned. Do I wish the zipper went down a bit further? Sure, but who cares? Amazing design and attention to detail. It feels incredible to wear. The straps are beautiful. The fabric is clutch. It stands up by itself! And the Endless Promise is the real deal. Great work, NEMO!
review.name: Killer bag!

name: Vantage Endless Promise 20L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
Aesthetically, this boot is beautiful. Looks like a fine hiking boot. Soft leather exterior, soft interior and Vibram lugged outsole.
I am a long-time Lake shoe user. Every model I've used has always been 45.5. I ordered the boots in 46, thinking they would be bigger than usual and the boot is sized for winter use. It was very short. I eventually found a local store to try on. Results: the 47 was still too short. the 48 was ideal. And this is with low-bulk socks. The shoelaces were good in creating a lockdown.
The sole. The picture used on BC's page is not accurate. I've seen the same picture in other stores too. The location for the SPD cleats needs to be cut out with a utility knife. There are not screws there to easily remove the rubber cover. 
I ultimately did not get these boots because it was just too much trouble to cut-out. The design made me feel that these were originally conceived for flat pedals and the SPD was an afterthought.
review.name: Runs Very Small & Sole Requires a Knife

review.reviewBody: Comfortable. Run very small. Went up 2 sizes. It was a pain to have to cut out the sole for the spd cleat. Did not keep my feet warm when colder than 40° F. Returned them but only got a credit as I had worn them twice.  I’m now using insulated Keen Targhee leather mid boots w flat pedals from Backcountry and my feet are toasty on the coldest days.
review.name: Good for spring and fall, not winter

name: MXZ200 Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.name: More torso length please

review.reviewBody: Great fit. Performs well on deck or for daily use.  Dry and warm in a lightweight package.
review.name: Best Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: Best jacket I’ve ever owned! In love the neoprene cuffs and cut built to layer on cold days.
review.name: Best Jacket!!

review.reviewBody: Heavy duty shell, maybe a tad on the stiff side. It’s Gore Tex so I know I’ll be dry. It’s Gruden’s I know it’s built right.
review.name: Love it! Especially at the sale price

review.reviewBody: Quality jacket. Keeps out the wind and rain. Can't go wrong with Grundens. Highly recommend.

review.reviewBody: Great fit and great style but way too stiff for me. Not a comfortable jacket But I’m sure it keeps you dry if you’re out on a boat and it’s raining
review.name: Buoy X

review.reviewBody: keeps me warm and dry. the cuffs keep water out of my sleeves while i’m working. so far it has held up very well
review.name: quality rain coat for work

review.reviewBody: Looked at alot of jackets. This one is top of the line, quality materials without a crazy price tag. Worth every penny. Made for fishing and the weather that comes with fishing. Wish I had found this jacket years ago!
review.name: Best of the best
